730860f-c.title: Bridges - Kosciusko Bridge - Newtown Creek - Brooklyn.
730860f-c.text:
Kosciusco Bridge, over Newtown Creek: The new vehicular bridge which replaced the old Penny Bridge.

For additional data see "The New York Times, September 23, 1940.

P. L. operr

August 22, 1939
Views 1-3

730859f-c.title: Bridges - Kosciusko Bridge.
730859f-c.text:
Eosciuszko Bridge: A view across the area in Brooklyn where the new Kosciuszko Bridge will be thrown across Newtown Creek, linking Meeker Avenue in Brooklyn and Laurel Hill Boulevard in
EQueens.
View 2 shows the S6,000,000 high-level span when completed, seen from Brooklyn. The bridge was formally named for the Polish patriot Thaddeus Kosciuszko by Mayor LaGuardia on September 22, 1940. For additional data see 'The New York Times," September 23,
1940.
View 1: August 13, 1938
View 2: August 22, 1939
P. L. Sperr
A more distant view of the bridge, seen from the Greenpoint
Avenue Bridge over New-town Srwek.
P.L.Sperr  July 26, 1939
